Core

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • Core.Sprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mario, MovableChar, Murciano, Rock, Suelo, Texto

    public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is the representation of a Sprite in a Pixel Field.

    It measures as a rectangle, has collision functions. Every class in a Pixel Field must extend from this class
    Version:
    0.8
    Author:

    Marc Albareda

    See Also:
    Git Repository

    • Field Detail

      • MARGIN

        public int MARGIN
        Margin to detect collisions. This will mark the horizontal range where a top-down collision will not be detected

      • DEPTH

        public int DEPTH
        Depth to detect collisions. This will mark the depth of the rectangle for the top/bottom/lateral rectangles

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        the name of the sprite

      • x1

        public int x1
        The horizontal position in the field of the upper-left pixel in the sprite

      • y1

        public int y1
        The vertical position in the field of the upper-left pixel in the sprite

      • x2

        public int x2
        The horizontal position in the field of the bottom-right pixel in the sprite

      • y2

        public int y2
        The vertical position in the field of the bottom-right pixel in the sprite

      • angle

        public double angle
        The rotating angle in degrees

      • path

        public java.lang.String path
        The path to the image to that Sprite

      • solid

        public boolean solid
        Specifies whether this Sprite is solid. Non-solid sprites will not collide.

      • terrain

        public boolean terrain
        Specifies whether this sprite is terrain. Terrains are immobile objects which can be collided and standed on.

      • unscrollable

        public boolean unscrollable
        Specifies whether this sprite is unscrollable. Unscrollables won't be scrolled ever. Used for HUD or fixed objects

      • text

        public boolean text
        Specifies whether this sprite is text. Text won't use an image path and will print the String specified as path.

      • font

        public java.awt.Font font
        Font for the text if the Sprite is used as text

      • textColor

        public int textColor
        Color for the text if the Sprite is used as text

      • img

        public java.awt.Image img
        image object for the sprite

      • useImgArray

        public boolean useImgArray
        checks if an img Array should be used instead of a single image

      • currentImg

        public int currentImg
        position of the image on the img array that should be accessed currently

      • imgArray

        public java.awt.Image[] imgArray
        array of images, needed if a single sprite has several images.

      • delete

        public boolean delete
        marks this Sprite to be deleted.

      • palleteSwap

        public boolean palleteSwap
        marks this sprite as a sprite with a palleteSwap

      • swapList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> swapList
        List of the required swaps. The even numbers will be replaced by the inmediately after number

        Parameters:

        public void palleteSwap(int c1,
                        int c2)
        Swaps the two colors
        Parameters:
        c1 - the color that will be swapped out
        c2 - the color that will be swapped in

      • collidesWithList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> collidesWithList(java.util.ArrayList<? extends Sprite> others)
        Returns the all the Sprites in the provided list that collide with this Sprite
        Parameters:
        others - A list of Sprites or classes that extends Sprite
        Returns:
        A list with all the sprites in the sprites list in the List that collides.
        Returns an Empty list if there is no collision with any Sprite

      • collidesWith

        public boolean collidesWith(Sprite other)
        Checks if this sprite collides with the provided sprite. It won't collide against non-solid sprites, or sprites marked as deleted
        Parameters:
        other - The other sprite

      • collidesWithPoint

        public boolean collidesWithPoint(int x,
                                 int y)
        Checks if this sprite collides with the point in coordinates x,y *
        Parameters:
        other - The other sprite

      • firstCollidesWithField

        public Sprite firstCollidesWithField(Field f)
        Returns the first Sprite in the provided filed that collides with this Sprite
        Parameters:
        f - A Pixel Field
        Returns:
        The first Sprite in the sprites list in the Pixel Field that collides.
        The Pixel Field is ordered by insertion in the code
        Returns null if there is no collision with any Sprite

      • collidesWithField

        public java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> collidesWithField(Field f)
        Returns the all the Sprites in the provided filed that collide with this Sprite
        Parameters:
        f - A Pixel Field
        Returns:
        A list with all the sprites in the sprites list in the Pixel Field that collides.
        The Pixel Field is ordered by insertion in the code
        Returns an Empty list if there is no collision with any Sprite

      • firstCollidesWithList

        public Sprite firstCollidesWithList(java.util.ArrayList<? extends Sprite> others)
        Returns the first Sprite in the provided list that collides with this Sprite
        Parameters:
        others - A list of Sprites or classes that extends Sprite
        Returns:
        The first Sprite in the llist that collides
        Returns null if there is no collision with any Sprite

      • getCollisionType

        public java.lang.String getCollisionType(Sprite other)
        Returns collision type
        Parameters:
        other - The second sprite
        Returns:
        A String depending on the collision type
        c: Contains. The other sprite is inside this
        i: Inside. This sprite is inside the other
        l: left. There is a collision between the left side of this sprite and any part of the other sprite
        r: right. There is a collision between the right side of this sprite and any part of the other sprite
        u: up. There is a collision between the upper side of this sprite and any part of the other sprite
        d: down. There is a collision between the bottom side of this sprite and any part of the other sprite
        o: other. There is another type of collision between the two sprites. They are colliding, but in an unexpected way
        n: none. There is no collision between the two sprites, or the other sprite is not solid.
        The string may contain several chars. for instance, "lu" would mean there is both a left and an upper collision.

      • stepsOn

        public boolean stepsOn(Sprite other)
        Checks if this sprite has the other sprite just below

        public boolean headOn(Sprite other)
        Checks if this sprite has the other sprite just above

        public boolean isGrounded(Field f)

      • isStuckOnTerrain

        Checks if this sprite is stuck on terrain

      • getGrounded

        public boolean getGrounded(Field f)
        Returns this sprite to ground level if it gets stuck into a terrain below it
        Useful for controlling landings
        Returns:
        true if it had succesfully unstucked the character, false if it wasn't stuck

      • getCeiling

        public boolean getCeiling(Field f)
        Returns this sprite to the appropiate position if it gets stuck into a terrain above it
        Useful for controlling jumps
        Returns:
        true if it had succesfully unstucked the character, false if it wasn't stuck

      • getSided

        public boolean getSided(Field f)
        Returns this sprite to the appropiate position if it gets stuck into a terrain on its sides
        Useful for controlling dashes
        Returns:
        true if it had succesfully unstucked the character, false if it wasn't stuck

      • deattach

        public boolean deattach(Field f)
        Returns this sprite to the appropiate position if it gets stuck into a terrain
        Returns:
        true if it had succesfully unstucked the character, false if it wasn't stuck

      • delete

        public void delete()
        marks this sprite to be deleted. Sprites marked for deletion won't collide or be drawn.
